div.p: This element is located in WRITING PRODUCTION . It captures all information about the nature of the copyright of the text and the relationship of the text to copyright. It encloses a phrase or sentence, and you may want to (but do not have to) include a title tag as well. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <PCOPYRIGHT>Elizabeth Barrett Browning's publisher suspended plans to publish her 1850 book of poems when another publisher pirated an edition. Because there was no copyright agreement between the US and Britain, and because the two publishers struck a gentlemen's agreement, EBB was never paid.</PCOPYRIGHT>

div.p: This element should be used only when there is a specific issue involving the copyright of a text or texts. If plagiarism is at issue, please use PAUTHORSHIP. May need to be used in conjunction with PCONTRACT or another tag to render its material searchable from more than one angle.
Question: My author sued her best friend for plagiarising her novel and infringing copyright. Do I use the PCOPYRIGHT tag?
Answer: Only if the issue of copyright is prominent in the case. Use RPENALTIES and perhaps PAUTHORSHIP.
